NKZ7ujgAZoCuX2KldLeWdQ.text: Jumbo seafood is definitely a must see for tourists and locals.  The food is fresh, service is outstanding and we actually happen to be at the restaurant when Gordon Ramsey was visiting..  If he came to the restaurant it must be good!

TQYlSiHwIzinhWxGe9fIOQ.text: Love this place!!! Ok so I haven't had Chili Crab everywhere, but this place is the best!!!

b4kMIHEmgYCzqwOuXqWLMQ.text: When we have out-of-town guests, we take them to Jumbos on East Coast or Red House at Robertson Quay if we are short on time.  Jumbos on the water is a fantastic experience getting the bibs and seeing the armada of ships vying for trade lanes.  Both the chili crab and pepper crab are consistently perfect tasting.  Even though Jumbos is always full, they've figured out a way to optimize the space so that the turnover happens at the same rate as people queuing up - so we've never had to wait for more than 5 minutes.  (To pass the time, check out the water skiing park next door if you have to wait...).   We have gone to Jumbos at Clarke Quay also, and it's great as well.  Atmosphere is just different - more yuppie/expat.  Very casual atmosphere and big round tables.  Bring your wet wipes, roll up your sleeves - and don't expect good lovin' tonight - as you will reek (in a good way) of garlic!

vZEDo5TJDvkRht7-K587ng.text: When in Singapore, you must partake in one of the island's most famous dishes: chilli crab. Tangy, a tad sweet, savory, and spicy, it hits all of your important taste buds and leaves you wanting more. It's messy, so get in there with your fingers and dig in, literally. Order some fried buns (mantou) to soak up some of that delicious chilli sauce, and you've got a fantastic meal. It gets pricey, but it's worth it. A few tips for those non-natives ( that I learned the hard way): there are no napkins. How you're expected to eat this crab with no provided napkins is beyond me, but that's how it's done in SG. Stop by a convenience store and pick up a multi-pack of tissues, since that's what everyone uses for napkins. The restaurant provides you with a finger bowl to rinse your hands while eating. If all else fails, watch the people around you and enjoy!

tklE94J6PEREodoBLmGDtw.text: Made reservations online and got seated right away despite long line. Not sure if it's BC it was only two of us BC everyone in line had a reservation.We ordered the famous chili crab, both fried and steamed mantou bread, and the fried frog legs in onion or something, and the famous beer (way overpriced).Hubby loved the Chili crab, slurped every last but up. It  was too sweet for me. I wish I got the black pepper one instead. The bread helped get the sauce off.It was my first time having frog and i loved it! Would come back just for that!

WUHSNKru6KuKoAv0QUCuDw.text: Tried the black pepper crab and also the chili crab I love the flavor and wish I could get more! The only problem was I broke out in a semi rash mode, not sure why but without that happening this place is a MUST!

photos.caption: Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore. Chili crab
Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore. Black pepper crab

aqtAQrJ61hoA4q34TYQ4XA.text: Delicious food, cool sea breeze, semidarkness (it was close to midnight and our second or third dinner of the day) = a perfect Jumbo experience.  We ordered a Chili Crab and a prawn dish which I can no longer remember.  The crab  meat was succulent and sweet, drenched in a thick sauce that was tangy-spicy-sweet all at once.  I could eat that sauce by the spoonful, but better to sop it up with golden fried buns.Service was efficient and friendly.

FtTaXQeT5Z8ycQ51IaVy1Q.text: Worth it for the Chili Crab alone, but a really cool experience overall.Wonderful views & breeze at dusk, plus non-stop service, rotating dishes of massive variety (if you order right) & all delivered with a relaxed & fun vibe even though the joint is pretty big & crowded.Disclaimer: Be prepared to get a bit messy.

TKhJak4GMLuHl-9I-plZ8A.text: Chili Crab. If you're visiting Singapore, you've probably been told that you _need_ to try it. Jumbo is one of the more famous chains which serve this Singaporean dish (the other is Longbeach).The chilli crab is a little sweet, a little spicy, and while the crab itself is good, it's the sauce that really stands out. Order a few of the fried mantou (buns) on the side, and get ready to soak up all that saucy goodness! (Trust me, you'll need more mantou than you think!)  For what you pay (about $55 a kg) it's pricey.  A crab will be anywhere between $50-80, and it's not a whole lot of food, but hey, when in Singapore...The cereal prawn ($20 or so) is also really good, make sure you order it with the shell off. Breaded in a slightly sweet and crunchy cereal breading, it's well worth a try.And don't be afraid of wearing the bib for the crab (ask for it if they don't offer), even the locals do it!

U4DUT9urpNCtHZn35usQ4A.text: Amazing chilli crab. The fried mantao are also a must if you get the chilli crab because they taste so great together! The service is not very attentive and you have to call a waiter if you need something since they don't check up on you but that's understandable since the restaurant is so packed. Make sure to make a reservation or you might have to wait a while!! Sitting outside when the sun is setting is great. The heat is combatted by the wind so you won't melt. If you want good lighting though, sit inside because the lighting after dark comes mostly from the large red sign that makes everything tinted red.

EPqOhkEHcDXKClfYNLxfiA.text: Delicious food, great service, and a beautiful view of the ocean. What more could you want?The black pepper crab is pretty much a standard order here. I haven't tried it anywhere else, so I can't say if it's the best one out there, but it's certainly delicious! Their other seafood items are excellent as well, and they can be prepared in pretty much any style you like. I'm personally a big fan of the garlic prawns, the steamed cod, and the yam scallops (these are especially fun, and very unique!). I would suggesting skipping the meat and rice dishes, since their specialty is seafood, and it can get a bit pricey ($30-$50 per person). Be sure to make a reservation before you go, since it's usually pretty crowded. It's a great place to go with a group (they have lots of big round tables to accommodate), and that can probably bring the cost per person down. If you plan on going here more than once, I also suggest signing up for their rewards program. You'll get a 10% discount on weekends, 20% on weekdays, and a free birthday cake from Bakerzin any day in the month of your birthday (make sure you call 4 days in advance though). The card costs $20, but you get that money back as credit, and you'll definitely end up saving more than that. So go there once, see if you like it, and if you think you'll be back there ever again, sign up for the card!

photos.caption: Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore. Free birthday cake (comes with take-away box, knife, and candles)
Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore. Garlic Prawns
Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore. Black Pepper Crab

PLG0Fb1g_vsZXBJuFh2duQ.text: If you like to experience a new place through its food then Jumbo is a Singapore establishment you must try. There are six in the area but my favorite is the East Coast Seafood Centre location, mostly because its an excuse to get away from downtown, but all of them or good. You'll find the restaurant to be chaotic, crowded, and filled with locals and tourists alike. The food is served family style and is often messy, but very good. There is lots to choose from and while the staff speaks limited English it isn't hard to order. I recommend reservations as it can get very crowed. You're hotel concierge can help you out there. Seafood Centre is a 15-20 minutes cab ride from downtown. You really can't go wrong with anything on the menu but the The Black Pepper or Chili Crab are must try items.

NhWMhSbGyvEUtHYSz1J54w.text: When I heard Jumbo Seafood, I wasn't all that excited to eat dinner there because I'm not a very big fan of seafood, but this place definitely changed my mind. I heard Singapore is known for their spicy crabs so of course we had to go somewhere really authentic to get it. This restaurant has a really nice bay view but it was raining that day so we couldn't sit outside to enjoy the scene. So the food. There was 13 of us and we ordered what seemed like everything on the menu so that we can try a little of everything. We got the spicy crab and the peppered crab which I guess for a non-seafood eater was pretty decent although I still wouldn't go out of my way to eat crab. My family really enjoyed it since they are seafood lovers. I do have to agree that it's probably the most flavorful crab I've ever tasted. To be honest, what I loved most about the meal was the little buns that came with the crabs. It really was just white dough with a little sugar but it was so soft and chewy and I think I probably had ten pieces all by myself. It was an overall good meal but because I don't really like seafood, I probably don't have the best judgment. One little boo boo was that they messed up our dessert and gave us a 13 people portion instead of a single serving like we asked and ended up just not giving us anything in the end after we waited for it foreverrrr. The service wasn't great but I guess we were a pretty loud annoying group with two babies that anyone would find hard to deal with.

AkqtKm0aHRBCidpoKNVUiw.text: Awesome food and great atmosphere. Went there on a Monday night and it was very busy. Make reservations ahead of time for sure. Probably one of the messiest meals I have ever had but well worth it. So make sure you wear clothes that you don't mind ruining. The black pepper crab is a perfect blend of spiciness sweetness and crab flavor. The chili crabs are delicious, the sauce is perfect and the bread is great. You can't go wrong, it's well worth the wait and the cost. The 1.2 kg crabs taste the best from what I am told. This was my first time and they taste perfect to me.

photos.caption: Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore. 1.2 kg chili crabs

3rFeRO8rlQaDceMsz1nZWQ.text: Chili crab was nice and spicy and pretty good.  Very expensive for what you get though. The cereal shrimp was yummy as well as the scallops with broccoli.  My favorite was the dried mini donut like breads that I used to sop up the chile crab sauce!

CMhZnovrM1gdixTbMDzDeQ.text: Chili crabs!! Black pepper crabs! My Singaporian friend said this was the best place to get them, and while I didn't try them anywhere else, I'll take her word for it -- they were delicious here. Get the mango drink and enjoy outside with a beautiful ocean view.

1D3ixkAws5JPaDDo_1E2YQ.text: The last couple of times we were in Singapore, hubby and I went to Long Beach which is next door to Jumbo but we decided to try Jumbo this time because we wanted to wear the Jumbo bib! We also usually get chilli crab but decided to try the black pepper crab this time which was awesome and so was the bamboo clams and sambal kangkong! All this only cost us Sg$110 which is much less than what we would pay in Australia. Glad we came here! Just a tip, get here early or you'll be waiting a while before you get a table. Oh and don't expect good service...

N99XMPYRxkMHvZ9eDHquBA.text: Ahhh East Coast Parkway.Ahhh Jumbo.Ahhh Chili Crab!Outdoor seating on patio tables and chairs.Large fans and a nice sea breeze to keep you cool while your mouth heats up.Popular place and it's easy to see why.

vZPkMZtg5BjblSx19RJbUg.text: If you travel to Singapore, this has to be a stop for you. Get the Chili Crab - we got three varieties. Its always crowded so be prepared, but they will serve you a beer while you wait. We chose to sit at a group table that seats about 10 people which was a great night. We sat with two other families and had a great time. Don't be shy and talk with your table mates. We had a great time talking with both families it was a great experience. The crab dishes are wonderful and full of flavor, well worth the price. We tried a variety of seafood appetizers and all were very good. We left stuffed. Plenty of wait staff on hand to take care of you.

pd64HI0KNqp9K10OlbwCwA.text: Rumour has it that Jumbo serves the best black pepper crab in town and I've been there enough times to say that their black pepper crab has got mojo.The pepper sauce manages to seep into the meat and coat it enough so that you get a hit of peppery goodness with every mouthful of crab. There's other places that serve black pepper crab and you can only taste the pepper on the shell but more often than not, Jumbo gets it right.I wont jump the gun and say this is the best ever black pepper crab, only because I havent gone on a black pepper crab spree to find the ultimate one. I would say this is the benchmark.

iAPpkscZtvxfB2rXAzrUGg.text: I rarely give 4 stars for restaurants. Jumbo has delicious food and a great atmosphere. We did not order any of their special crab on our last visit, but everything else was perfectly cooked and flavorful. Pretty good service too. A bit on the expensive side and not close to home so we will only go here every 6 months or so.

umezWuULxTdaOkiIWRZzaA.text: Jumbo didn't fail to deliver a yummy chilli crab famous in Singapore for a reason - deliciousness

IgCrdOklNGsjwM5NBFK6tw.text: The Chili Crab is an absolute must for crab lovers when visiting Singapore - it is one of the most delicious dishes you can possibly eat and possibly the messiest as you don't want to leave even a small morsel of crab behind.  The crab is perfectly seasoned in a garlic, ginger, chili sauce that complements the taste of crab - does not over power so the taste of crab comes through - there is so much of it, you'll want to have it over rice.  The cost justifies the quality of the dish.

photos.caption: Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore. Chilli Crab

p0zTTXEGJfZhuS6VCj65uA.text: CHILI CRAB.  Enough said.There is nothing like this back in the states, so if you're visiting Singapore, I strongly recommend a visit to Jumbo Seafood.  Things to keep in mind when planning dinner here.  The wait time is LONGGGGGG.  Be sure to call for a reservation or show up really early to put your name down.  If you're at the waterfront, note that there are two restaurants within 10 minutes walking distance of each other.  I stopped by the busier location first at the end of the canal and was told the wait would be 3 hours long.  I found some wifi and noticed another location 10 minutes down the canal and walked that way to kill some time.  I had to walk under a bridge, but once I got to the other side, I found the other location which only had a 15 minute wait. Things to order:- Chili Crab (be aware that i'll cost you ~$50-60 USD per crab)- Pepper Crab - Garlic Ong choy veggies- Man tou (bread rolls, asian style)

photos.caption: Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore. Aftermath
Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore. Chili crab
Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore. Chili crab

0HDlqpszn7JcpTatRECdbA.text: This place is so much better than No Sign Board. The chili crab was on point the flavor the sauce was not too sweet and not too spicy. I loved the crab was really fresh. The view isn't bad either. I will definitely be back when I'm in Singapore.

photos.caption: Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore. Team dinner
Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore. Chili crab
Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore

ryG6GEFMKOy3x1QQBD9wUA.text: We visited Jumbo Seafood with a group of friends to finally try the famous chili crab. We also got black pepper crab, clams, and some veggies as well. The food was tasty and the bib provided was absolutely necessary! I was a mess! I actually liked the pepper crab more than the chili crab because it was too sweet for my tastes. The fresh coconut was the perfect choice to combat some of the spice!The setting of the restaurant next to the beach allowed for a nice breeze. The place is great for groups with large tables that featured turn tables that are ideal for family-style meals.It was approximately $80 per person, which was reasonable for the amount of crab we ordered. For the price, I expect a bit more upscale ambiance and more attentive service. My official rating would be 3.5 out of 5 stars. If we've got a large group of guests looking to enjoy the ocean and a Singaporean traditional meal, I'll likely take them here.

photos.caption: Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore. Pepper crab
Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore. Prawns
Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore. Clam

WIZh6VCl_igI_tLVeFTPhA.text: Absolutely one of my favorite restaurants in the world (and I do mean the entire world).  When I lived in Singapore we came to the East Coast Jumbo regularly and always brought out of town guests. The one on the East Cost is the best (IMHO). There is nothing fancy about this restaurant.  Come to sit by the ocean on uncomfortable plastic chairs, enjoy some cold beer, and devour as many crabs as you can.  The awesome Jumbo experience is very simple and consists of only five elements, so anyone can execute this plan.  Here it is:1) Sit outside, not inside2) Order beer, and then keep ordering it throughout the meal (you'll see why shortly)3) Order lots of Chili Crabs4) Order a ton of Man-tou buns (fried, not steamed).5) After you are done with the first 4 things, order Sago for dessert (even if the waitstaff gives you a hard time about it).I believe Chili Crab may be one of nature's most perfect food substances.  The crab is huge, meaty, and sweet.  The sauce is beyond compare - rich, tangy, and oh so spicy.  And extra good when you sop it up with the Man-tou (kind of like little savory doughnuts).  Lot's of fried spicy goodness there.  Order double the number of buns they suggest - I seem to prefer a higher bun to sauce ratio then is standard.I see many reviewers indicate you should go with Black Pepper Crab.  While that is a fine dish, I've always preferred the sauciness of Chili Crab.  But try them both - you can't go wrong.  Also, remember to wear clothes that can get soiled.  Those crabs are messy, but that is half the fun.Finally, let me put in a word for Sago.  It's kind of like cold sweetened coconut soup with melon balls and ice shavings.  Delicious, refreshing, and the perfect antidote to your burning lips from the yummy Chili Crab.  My Father almost passed out from delight the first time he had Sago here.In short, when I next make the long, long, long trip from Chicago to Singapore I will be heading to Jumbo.

VwHjdsxDXF0qxytPWA7BKg.text: The seafood was very jumbo as the name promised. A little too big in areas but I dealt. :) great place to go if you need a little aphrodisiacs in your life!

2ySPB6qDvS8dtyj7pOI_eg.text: Looking for a late evening meal on a long layover in Singapore.  Hours posted are until midnight. Arrived at 11:10 after a $25 uber ride.  I was told they had taken their last order and was refused service, even though there were at least 30 customers still eating.  I own a restaurant and this is one of my pet peeves. We serve until 10 minutes after the posted closing time. If you want to close at 11 just post an 11 closing time.

qOEcjLEx3V4PNa5ib0av9g.text: First make a reservation. Avoid the lines. Still not a fan of the sneaky charging of peanuts, tea etc which I guess is a Singaporean thing. Anyway, the black pepper crab is very nice. I think the chili is better but nice to have alternatives. Regarding the venue, you can have a nice stroll on ecp afterwards. I suppose if you can get the outdoor seating, that would be more charming. Jumbo is a must visit if you are visiting Singapore.

photos.caption: Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore. Chili crab
Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore. Black pepper crab

o1IU3rQc00EwIhi1qNu5NA.text: Overrated.Chili crab was okay. Wasn't as fresh as the hype would've lead us to believe. Breaded scallops were elegant, mantou bread was nom-worthy, and the fried rice was great... and the service was quite decent.We had a reservation inside, and hence ate inside-- but I think outside is the better experience.We had some amazing food-- and from the popularity of the Jumbo chain, I assume they're capable of excellent food-- but for whatever reason, our experience was decidedly so-so as soon as the signature dish came out. We even made it a point to come to this specific location, as friends said this one was the best. Maybe they were wrong?

NCIdFLTCbWW_wi6fyr1b2g.text: Gross. Disgusting. Icky. These are just some of the words you will be using to describe your eating experience at Jumbo. Not because of the food, no, no, but because of how messy you will get eating the delicious, drool inducing chili crab. This is some of the best stuff on earth. Seriously. If you come here for nothing else you will be quite happy. The crab is really fresh and the sauce is just so he right amount of spicy. It's very messy and finger lickin good. We also had the cereal prawn that was just a bit too sweet, it tastes very similar to coconut shrimp and also the yam covered scallops. They were also very good. You obviously have to have beer with your chili crab so make sure to grab a pitcher of tiger. This is the third or fourth time here from America, I will always come back here to eat. I love it so much. I'll be coming here for years to come. I wish they sold the chili sauce by the gallon. I would just drink it.

se1dEUg9YRR1YknnSljAPw.text: Amazing food! Cant go wrong with anything you order if you're not picky.  Service is fast but need some English language improvement.

photos.caption: Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore. PepperCrab
Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore. Chillicrab

3U_6b5yoXEOfOscTe0ltrg.text: My cousin's family took us to this place, which seemed less touristy than clarke quay, but still massively crowded. If you're in the CBD I wouldn't travel all the way out here unless you wanted to check out the east coast park and beaches.First off, this place is outdoors and hot AF...and it's very close to the strait of Singapore, so it does have a nice ocean breeze.It's definitely pricey, like $50-60 per crab, but any crab that's damn near a kilo will be. Much different than the USA blue crabs or king/snow crab legs...they give you a bib for a reason.While I did enjoy the Chilli Crab, the Black Pepper Crab is even better. Apparently the ish is to get deep fried mantou (those white chinese bread things), which you can then dip in the sauce. A little too rich for me, I prefer rice! They ran out of razor clams :'( We also ordered cereal prawns and deep fried crispy squid; cereal prawns are unique, I wasn't a huge fan of the squid, it didn't taste bad or anything, just not my ish.4 stars only because it's very much like a factory and I felt like the waitrons were trying to constantly upsell with more food than needed, special order desserts (apparently they take a while), and threatening that if you don't order now it'll take an hour (???). That being said, there are a ton of diners, so it's somewhat plausible, I'm just not that used to it.

Aa4FGe5gAGM0dMm6MltOgA.text: After going to the Jumbo at Clarke Quay, and being blessed with an "extra" night in Singapore of course I would choose to have Jumbo as my last meal in this great food city.This location is right on the water similar to Clark Quay, but not the river. The ocean breeze that night was quite cool and a pleasant change to the heat of the day. We were seated right away, and requested to be seated outside so we could enjoy the weather (better than being in 20 degrees and snow in NJ). The food was great and just as I had remembered it from two nights before. This time, we went with the Black Pepper Crab and Chili Crab (again), but also tried the Salted Egg Prawns and the Tofu dish. Again, everything did not have a chance once it hit the table. Each nook and cranny of the crabs was cleaned up, combined with the fried buns and chili sauce. As it was my last night in Singapore, I thought it would be good to buy the mix to take back to the States to have a crack at making it myself one day.Startlingly impressive food; makes you eat beyond capacity.

photos.caption: Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore. Chili crab. Black pepper crab. Fried buns.

PCUrmx93oJQipq5QDNXoCg.text: Big, generous portions of fresh seafood is what you'll find here. We tried the iconic chilli crab - very messy but what a delicious mess! Ask for the cute little buns to mop up that killer sauce. The buns themselves are soft like pillows.The fried tilapia with mango salsa is really flavourful and doesn't feel too heavy despite being fried. Wash it all down with a Thai coconut.

photos.caption: Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore. Little buns
Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore. Chilli crab
Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore. Fried whole tilapia

3dtH2CePe36UIZLiRaoXjw.text: This was my 2nd time in the same day eating at Jumbo. I first ate at the one in Clarke Quay, and then when the boss flew in he wanted to go to this one. We were seated quite quickly due to our reservation, and it was outside the restaurant closer to the water. I didn't really like our table because it was pretty close to where everybody goes to smoke so I occasionally had the odor of cigarette smoke while eating, but it wasn't too bad.The Chili crab and satays were very good, but the black pepper crab was too peppery.The cereal prawns had a lot of cereal but not too much prawn. The fish in banana leaf was decent. Overall it was pretty decent but I wouldn't go out of my way to go back.

-5z1quf3ZEk5GQC6p1PdkA.text: The usual Singaporean-go-to spot for seafood. The east coast branch is by far the most popular on the island. I am guessing it's because of its complimentary location near the sea adds to one's seafood dining experience. It's super crowded on weekend evenings. Do not attempt to go without a booking, especially if it is a public holiday weekend. Overall, Jumbo doesn't disappoint. It serves quality seafood amidst a casual and family-friendly environment. Singaporean families (across generations - think aunty, uncle, cousins...) gather here for good seafood. Food: 1. Pepper crab - Awesome! Get your bibs ready! It can get messy. 2. Chili crab sauce & man tou - I LOVE their man tous (fried buns). It's fried to golden perfection! Crispy on the outside but soft & smooth on the inside. I could eat a plate of these (they are pretty small in size), especially dipped in chili sauce. TIP: you can order the chili crab sauce without having to order the whole crab itself. So you can have your crab in another sauce (black pepper) and still get to enjoy the wholesome goodness of dipping your man tous in the chili sauce. Double happiness. 3. Fried you tiao - LOVE! These are fried doughs stuffed with fish paste. It may sound strange to foreigners but they are heavenly. A must-try for sure. 4. Mee goreng - Good. A little spicy though. Be warned. 5. Mix vegetable & mushrooms - Good. The mushrooms were so fresh. 6. Steam prawns with egg - LOVE! The prawn was so fresh & sweet. It comes served with a sweet black sauce which goes so well with the prawns. I could eat this all day. Service: - Very efficient!

photos.caption: Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore

v10tDNLqCahvJ5zMjQoraQ.text: In my many trips to Singapore, I always stop into Jumbo just so I can indulge myself with the best they have to offer. What is the best you might ask? Well the chilli crab is one, the second is the pitcher of lime juice, and third is the fresh rolls that they offer. When you get the chilli crab and the rolls are in front of you, I got 3 words for you... dunk the rolls! Get those fresh hot buns covered in the chilli crab sauce and let it take you to cloud 9. You canalso requestfor them to giveyou bibswhich ishighly recommended as the seafood had a tendency to go flying around.  To top it off,  there are also outdoor seating available for you to enjoy the oceanfront via while eating during the day or harbor lights at night. Either way, it is a nice perk especially for you romantics out there!  Big props, I don't give out 5 stars to really but Jumbo has done something right here.

photos.caption: Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore

E6vmvVBBU7yaJeExcHVUdQ.text: Went to Jumbo on my first trip to Singapore, and I am already trying to plan another vacation back out here just to get the Chili Crab! Came here with a large party for dinner and sat outside. It was really nice to sit along the water and the weather was just right- no jacket needed and it was cool nice breeze (good break from all the humidity!)Ordered and sampled a variety of things and was not disappointed in any thing!By far the chili crab was my favorite! Saw you could buy a mix to take home and make yourself but I didn't in fear it would not turn out the same. In California we have different types of crab so was almost positive it would not turn out the same :( It's also really good if you dip your bread into the chili sauce! The tangy, sweet, spicy and savory sauce it comes with is to diiiiiie for! Devastated theres nothing like this in the US!Pepper crab- delicious! Perfect blend of a spicy and sweetness of a crabBoiled live shrimp comes in a wine soup - get about 3 per person.Chicken/Beef kabobs- tastes good if you dip it in their peanut sauce!Malaysia dry noodle- reminded me to be similar to a spaghetti with seafood in it. Mango- not sure if its the right season or if its just always good- but the mango is soft and sweet! perfect way to end your meal.Ate a lot more- but can't remember the names. If I can remember the names I will update this review accordingly!Staff is great and attentive- always there to switch out your messy plates and bring more stuff to the table as needed. Free wifi for restaurant guests- on the table you will see the wifi name and password.

UA0r5nYd1uJuFftVYCJnWg.text: If you could give 0 stars...After longing for a nice evening seaside in the nearby hawker center and finding out it's closed due the to spring cleaning (who would have known), we went to a well known seafood place with chili crab specialities. Place is clean with wipes and bowls to clean ones hands.A lady came to pour us some tea which we found out was not complementary after talking to her for 5 minutes, so we gallantly denied the tea.The main waiter came and took our order. We weren't sure how big the portions were so we asked for how much people the medium portion is meant. 4-6 he said, but we wanted to share by 2 so we took the 2-3. First our friend got his fried fish which came pretty late so we shared that. His side order would not arrive for the next 30 minutes.Our dish came and is meant for one person with a small stomach. Trying to find the waiter without success we got pretty angry but decided not to do anything about it. When the side dish came after 2 times asking again, we shared that as well. Maybe we should have ordered the 160Sin$ Lobster...maybe than we would have been treated like real customers.

y7trXQhNbDraUFgslCYhKQ.text: Not sure why this place is so highly recommended - it's bloody awful... probably the worst place we have ever eaten at.It is touristy, overpriced and actually not very good at all...  Singaporeans tell me it's just for the tourists and they do a lot of advertising to be well known...We actually felt sick after eating here - nothing was really fresh or healthy and it was just your typical chinese food covered in sticky, gooey sauce...Two of the dishes we ordered had pictures on the menu and they looked nothing like it when they arrived ;-)   The cod was certainly frozen and not fresh and the deep fried squid tasted of rotten fish.I know this sounds unbelievable for such a well known restaurant, but I can tell you the other English people sat close by to us were also not happy and arrived after us and left before us... so we were not alone in our thinking! Our taxi driver laughed when we told him we hated it and he told us we should have eaten at the Eastcoast Hawker Centre as it's better, more authentic and cheaper - I wish we'd known that before we spent a fortune here ;-)Definitely not a recommend!

So7zAsNyD3T2V5h11C46lw.text: Ordered the chili crab and black pepper crab and noodles and seafood soup plus a veggie dish and the beggars stew.    The food was all tasty but lacked in spice. The shrimp in the food was small.  The biggest problem was the service.  We did not get rice until we asked 3 times and never got the chili sauce or hot sauce we kept asking for.   The chili crab never came out until we were done with everything else on the table, by then way too late as it was obvious we were ready to leave and not too happy.  You would think at $75 per crab they would treat you with a little more respect!

UOIg8v6DC2NCmeaH17anmg.text: Signature Chili Crab was a wondrous experience!Great service too and fast.  So many side items also hit the mark, superb Bamboo Clams, tender and succulent.  They were overshadowed by the crab which was MEGA FRESH and meaty.  Save the crab for last.  Pro-Tip.If you leave this place hungry you're doing it wrong.

wdWm0yu9VODzUa4AvgbbCg.text: There are so many different places that that serve chili crab and so many different ways people try to infuse chili crab into dishes. After a fair amount of internet research, I decided to go with Jumbo which would provide a "nicer" restaurant experience and would have great chili crab - we were not disappointed. I made a reservation through Chope which is highly advisable, particularly on a weekend night. I didn't see many people queuing, but all of the tables were full. We had an early reservation and were able to secure an outdoor table where we could enjoy the sunset and view (but beware of mosquitos!). We ordered a chili crab (a "medium" sized one which was plenty for the three of us), a side of vegetables, steamed rice and chow mein. The chili crab was delicious and has the right balance of heat and sweetness. Definitely order steamed rice to drench your rice in the crab and sauce. The chow mein was underwhelming.

photos.caption: Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore. Outside seating at Jumbo Seafood
Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore. Chili crab

HTvjOsjqslKQ5qJY7kiLag.text: Make no mistake...this is a tourist trap. Back in the days before Jumbo Seafood IPO on the stock exchange, prices were more affordable & reasonable. Right now, expect exorbitant prices of the seafood dishes. I went there with the family (16 of us) and ordered steam prawns, chili crap, salted egg crap, sambal kang kong, fried baby squid, Chinese donut, fried mee goreng, hot plate tofu & desserts, with a jug of beer...total bill came to $877!!!  Unfortunately, this will be my last visit to Jumbo Seafood.

gJXSCxQGR5T7-qMKC3zlIQ.text: A Singapore institution for seafood. Definitely get the Chili Crab. It's a giant crab served in a sweet spicy sauce. Also get the man tou (pan-fried bread) to dip in the crab sweet spicy sauce. Quality of the crab is excellent - sweet fresh crab that goes well with the sauce. The black pepper crab is not as good though so perhaps stick to the chili crab for Jumbo. The seafood is fresh in general - we also enjoyed the ginger and scallion prawn and steamed fish.

photos.caption: Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore. Steamed fish in soy sauce
Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore. Chili crab with Mantou (Back)
Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore. Salt and Pepper shrimp

tnlmbm9McZEO0tzuVAykfA.text: Chili crab it is!!! First time in Singapore and the hype is real about chili crab.  Went with a few colleagues and wanted to know what the fuss was.  The restaurant itself was full of people: locals, tourist, people celebrating, etc.  definitely a crowd.  Almost every dish we had was superb and full of flavor.  Ambiance was great and decent service.  It is pricey however.Could honestly just eat the bread dipped into the chili crab sauce all day!  The chili crab itself was very delicious and you can kind of understand why it's a must try!  Also got the prawns with cereal.  I was kind of unsure about this dish, but I am glad I ate it.  Very different but unique and taste great!  The golden Phoenix chicken!!! One of my favorites!

photos.caption: Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore

n4miSLLk_wAwOGmIeOaqnA.text: Great location on waterfront. Make a reservation as it's a destination for many tourists and locals celebrating events.You have to try the chili crab and or black pepper crab. Huge, tasty and enough for 2-3 folks.If you speak mandarin, it helps. We had one person in group who did and made ordering and service better.

photos.caption: Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore. View from water in early evening
Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore. Chili Crab

_aPjI_4ijf6EdjiIg5jROw.text: I believe this is the only one that takes reservations Arrived on schedule n sat down promptly . Ordered the recommemd Chili crab and bamboo muscle , cereal shrimp .. the chili crab delicious as everyone described .. cereal shrimp was too sweet for my taste. Overall a bit pricy but worth the try!

photos.caption: Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore. Chili crab~

MFbWZrdLSZhbvBbTbkp41g.text: As many have already said, you must try chili crab in Singapore, and every time I'm here, this is the place I go.  It's a large crab, some of the pieces require a bit of patience to get the meat out, but wow is it delicious.  Get the fried rolls to dip into the sauce.  In fact, grab a spoon and just shove that delicious sauce into your mouth.  It's that good.I also tried the sambal shrimp, which was delicious as well with plump shrimp and little pieces of pineapple in it. Hotel called in a reservation and I was seated immediately.  Warning: It is messy!

i5An5S1Ehq6aTihbFfwmiw.text: Came here my last day in Singapore since I felt like chili crab is an obligated must eat. This place has a huge outdoor seating with quite minimum wait. Service was great as our server even helped us to crack the crab more.Onto the food, we got the more expensive Alaskan deep sea crab cuz there was a "promotion". The dish came like warm. This was not my first time eating chili crab in jumbo or no signboard and luke warm crab was not satisfying. The chili sauce was amazing as it seems like they put broken crab meat in it. Overall, I think jumbo or no signboard have both going downhill in terms of quality. Maybe next time chili crab should no longer be my must eat.

FCE7mm7sqpbzN94AGCisUQ.text: Never disappoints!  Excellent chili crab and even better pepper crab. Don't miss the deep fried baby octopus.Sit outside and enjoy the balmy weather and the pitchers of tiger beer. The food here is always a highlight.

3xW32QpxJ2CJjUo-2Tzy8g.text: We came with a table of 10+9 for a big family dinner and the service was extremely slow. We came on a Sunday night for dinner. Dishes came out one by one and the table would be empty for a good 5-10 minute between dishes. This is not typically for a family style, Asian restaurant. The staff and kitchen usually time the dishes better so there's a continuous flow of food. Most of the food was cold when arrived, but very flavorful. The main dish was the black pepper crab and it was quite delicious. Very nice pepper taste that left your mouth tingling a bit with spice; would have tasted better if the dish was warmer. Overall, food is not bad. The reason for the 2 is due to the slow service and cold food. I hope this restaurant can staff up and be more efficient with the dining experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore. Black Pepper Crab.

OYfOsKT5gBTsNyh5CEDFZA.text: On our last night in Singapore, my boyfriend's mother and sister took us to Jumbo Seafood where we had a beautiful waterfront view. Although I love crab, my boyfriend isn't a fan but we still decided to go because our new friends in Hong Kong raved about trying pepper and/or chili crab. We ordered:- Chili crab- Fried cod fish with spicy sauce- Scallops wrapped in yam ring- Broccoli with scallops- Steamed (white) buns and deep fried bunsThe chili crab was wonderful! The crab we received, a portion size for three people, was the largest crab I've ever seen!! Certainly fitting considering the name of the restaurant. I'm not usually a fan of filling up on bread, but it was difficult to resist dipping the steamed buns in the chili crab sauce. And.. this is was after I ate spoonfuls on top of my rice. So much flavor!The broccoli with scallops were fine, but the scallops wrapped in yam were even better! My boyfriend almost decided to get a second order of them. Finally, the fried cod fish was delicious! I would order that again as well. Our bill ended up around SGD 200-250.. If you're not opposed to taking a day trip to Malaysia (possible via bus, car or taxi), we were told you can get much more pepper or chili crab for much cheaper there! Regardless, I highly recommend you check this place out if you're in Singapore! Extra tips and FYIs:- There is no AC!- Make reservations if you want to avoid a long wait during certain days or times.- The menu has plenty of pictures and English to help guide your ordering.- Chili crab can be quite messy; I recommend using the disposable bibs they give out.- Don't be afraid to flag down any server you see if you need something!- If you have trouble breaking through the HUGE claws or other parts of the crab, you can put them on a plate and ask the server to have the kitchen break them for you! You don't want any going to waste :)

75EspzPKOmyyeSGznvnUHw.text: Chili crab with extra sauce with man tao and black pepper crab! So good :) I was quite surprised at the chili crab because I wasn't sure what to expect other than I hear Singaporeans chili crab is really good. And that it was, I found it to be the perfect balance of taste and spicy. It was quite good and the black pepper was a good flavor too. Definitely was a messier meal and expect to get your hands finger licking dirty with yummy sauce. The crab was fresh and good quality. The fresh prawns were also quite good and plump! And we had an 2 appetizers, one was scallops and taro while the second was a tofu dish. And a salted fish chicken fried rice.Service was not the best but fine, just had to wave them down for a little. Location is great because here is indoor covered outdoor seating and it's on the oceanfront so you can have a nice view as well as walk along the water before or after your meal. Would definitely return and bring guests that visit too Tip: reservations so you don't have to queue. But even if you do, it's not too bad if you go early Tip 2: bring some napkins and don't wear white in case you get it dirty when you use your hands for the crab

photos.caption: Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore

GBUN3rYm2QFQyAo2TVcYFw.text: This restaurant is very close to the airport, we all loved foods here especially crab and BBQ fish, reasonable price, but it's difficult to get a taxi in the night.

photos.caption: Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore

h-vqtDU5wGY93Mmb00Cr4g.text: Came here on a Monday night due to a recommendation from a local friend and this place was packed! We didn't have a reservation but luckily were seated within 10 minutes. We ordered both the famous chili crabs as well as the black pepper crabs. They'll provide you with bibs which were an absolute must because the sauce can easily get everywhere.The sauce from the chili crab was perfectly seasoned! Rich and thick yet not too spicy. Tons of flavor imbued in every bite. I simply couldn't stop eating it. Then the black pepper crabs arrived and I started devouring those too, although I did find the kick of the pepper to be actually a tad bit stronger than the chili version.If you make it out here, you won't go wrong with either dish. But just to be safe, you should definitely order both!

photos.caption: Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore. Chilli crab
Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore. Pepper crab

H0ZvwOjY1dAgx3VCOCHL8A.text: Gotta try the pepper crab..... I know everyone says chili crab but love the pepper crab. The noodles and 空心菜 is yum yum. A must try Singapore classic.

photos.caption: Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore

mtvG9IX0a-t8xdB6-a72aA.text: When in Singapore, you must try chilli crab - or atleast that's what any guide book seems to insist. Suppressing all scepticism, I took a visiting friend to Jumbo which is one of the four chilli crab Meccas here all lined conveniently next to each other along East Coast park. We got one chilli crab to share between two of us which cost around $62. No chilli crab is complete without deep fried buns to mop up the gravy and Jumbo's are just sheer perfection: crispy on the outside and warm and fluffy on the inside with just a slight sweetness to them. At this point, I need to throw up my hands and admit that YES Jumbo's serves some pretty damn good chilli crab. The gravy is delicious. Rich and thick, the best part is the sharp kick to it at the end. I was expecting it to be a lot spicier than it was but it had too much flavour packed into it to make up for it. The crab itself was juicy and tender. We struggled to get all the flesh out of the shell but it's worth prying out every little bit. The atmosphere is also incredibly relaxing especially if you snag an outside table right next to the ocean. The staff were all very prompt and efficient. We were the last ones to leave the restaurant but they made no motion to hurry us and even gave us a 10% discount at the end for no reason! My only gripe is the very small vegetarian selection which is somewhat understandable at a seafood restaurant. My mother got rice with vegetable stir fry which came in a tiny portion costing $18. Total rip off for a very average tasting dish.

photos.caption: Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore. Chilli crab with deep fried buns

9Le3wWYyVNvATN6PgRJ6Gg.text: Came here for the pepper crab and chili crab. Just get the pepper crab; it's far superior to the chili crab.  Also, don't order the special menu for "8 people" or "6 people". It's very expensive, and they give you some weird stuff (for non-singaporeans) that are not very tasty. I would just order off the menu only.

a63c0QN5Ac7OA7QMh-ZzKQ.text: Best of Singapore food, both black pepper and chili crab prawns too. 2 lb crab from Sri Lanka.

photos.caption: Photo of Jumbo Seafood - Singapore, Singapore

XvyJsFrXH4n2XSm9UAZtLw.text: One star for the food. The steam prawns over cooked. Moreover, steam prawns should come out first instead last. Very pricey! There was cockroach crawled on my wife leg. The seafood horfun was tasteless. When asked for feedback online, of course, we give feedback both online and verbal but they did nothing to win us back.
